articles.title: Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign Criticized
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign Criticized
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson of the Korea Association for Human Rights Studies gave the following answer to question raised by KCNA on Friday as regards the fact that the riff-raff are now resorting to "human rights" campaign against the DPRK:
					 Recently, the deputy director of the "Citizens' Alliance for North Korean Human Rights", an anti-DPRK "human rights" conspiracy organization in Seoul of south Korea, made reference to the invitation extended to foreign advertising agencies to the 2017 International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) Challenge Pyongyang Open in August. He prattled that they opposed the activities of the advertising agencies in north Korea as the income generated from the advertising could end up in the hands of the north Korean government which is under a tough sanctions regime.
					
					 Meanwhile, the "Special Rapporteur" of the UN Human Rights Council on the situation of human rights in the DPRK is reported to visit south Korea from July 17 to 21 to meet with south Korean government officials and "defectors" to collect latest "information" on human rights situation of the DPRK, and submit a report thereon to the 72nd session of the UN General Assembly in coming October.
					
					 It is an international practice to conduct advertising through such authoritative sports events as the Table-Tennis Open organized by the ITTF in Pyongyang and, for this purpose, commercial contracts are concluded between the organizers and advertising agencies. It is a well-known fact that its income is used for the development of sports. 
					
					 Nevertheless, such conspiracy organization as the "Citizens' Alliance for North Korean Human Rights" is taking issue with the income from advertising, linking it with inhumane sanctions against the DPRK. While this is a presumptuous act, it also clearly shows that they are pursuing ulterior political purposes.
					
					 If the "Citizens' Alliance for North Korean Human Rights" is to be a proper organization, it should first rename itself "Citizens' Alliance for South Korean Human Rights" and pick quarrel with the ongoing violations of human rights in south Korea, including discrimination and sexual abuse against foreign workers. In particular, it should remedy the practices of sexual harassment of local women by south Korean diplomats in several countries which have been recently exposed one after another, causing world-wide consternation and resentment.
					
					 We remain consistent in our position to categorically reject the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" cooked up by the hostile forces on the basis of false "testimonies" of the human scum "defectors" and the "Special Rapporteur" on the situation of human rights in the DPRK appointed in accordance with the "resolution".
					
					 However, from the standpoint of actively engaging in dialogue and cooperation for the genuine protection and promotion of human rights, we invited in May last the Special Rapporteur of the UN Human Rights Council on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and discussed the implementation of the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in all sincerity. We will also participate in the sessions for consideration of the reports on implementation of the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women in coming September and November respectively.
					
					 The "Special Rapporteur" on the situation of human rights in the DPRK should not go about looking for the "testimonies" of "defectors" whose truth is no longer recognized by the world public. Instead, he should make a thorough investigation into the human rights violations in south Korea, the worst tundra of human rights in the world, and bring to justice those criminals who lured and kidnapped a group of female citizens of the DPRK to detain them in south Korea for over one year.

articles.title: U.S. Blamed for Pressing S. Korea into Renegotiations over FTA
articles.content:
U.S. Blamed for Pressing S. Korea into Renegotiations over FTA
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Economic Cooperation in a statement Friday denounced the U.S. for pressurizing south Korea into renegotiations over "Free Trade Agreement".
					 Recently Trump let the U.S. trade mission unilaterally notify the south Korean authorities that it would get into the procedures for the re-negotiations over FTA and, accordingly, south Korea was forced into sitting before the humiliating negotiating table.
					
					 The recent unilateral notification concerning the FTA renegotiations by Trump clearly proves the impudent nature of the U.S. indifferent to the destiny of a colonial stooge for its own interests, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 By nature, the south Korea-U.S. FTA was signed as traitor Lee Myung Bak yielded to the U.S. pressure, and it is an unequal and traitorous "agreement" nothing helpful to the people's livelihood.
					
					 By this shackling "agreement" south Korea's agricultural and livestock products, fisheries market and services field were fully opened and the previous system that restricted foreign investment in the major industrial field was eased, flinging the door open to the U.S. monopoly capitalists.
					
					 All facts prove that the U.S. is a shameless dominator and predator indifferent to the south Korean economy and the livelihood of its people in order to serve its selfish purposes.
					
					 South Korea is obliged to offer not only its liver and gallbladder but also heart to the master keen on sucking all juice from the south Korean people with a firm hold on the lifeline of south Korea. This is the due outcome of the successive puppet rulers' sycophancy toward the U.S.
					
					 No matter how desperately the south Korean authorities may justify "south Korea-U.S. alliance", they can never cover up their deplorable fate no more than the puppet of the U.S.
					
					 The south Korean authorities allegedly speaking for the candlelight demonstrators should come to their senses and part with the policy of submission to the U.S. and sycophancy toward it, not moving at its beck and call.

articles.title: Vice Foreign Minister of DPRK Visit Egyptian Embassy
articles.content:
Vice Foreign Minister of DPRK Visit Egyptian Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Ho Yong Bok, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, paid a congratulatory visit to the Egyptian embassy here on the occasion of its national day.
					 He met Egyptian Ambassador Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady and congratulated the 65th anniversary of the July 23 revolution in Egypt and had a talk with the ambassador.
					
					 He said that the bilateral relations are steadily developing under the deep care of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and stressed the need to continue strengthening the historical and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 The ambassador expressed thanks for the congratulatory visit by officials of the Foreign Ministry including the vice-minister and hoped that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would develop on a higher stage in conformity with the common desire of their peoples.
					
					 They exchanged views on the situation of the Middle East and the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Egyptian Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Egyptian Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Egyptian Ambassador to the DPRK Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Friday to mark the 65th anniversary of the July 23 revolution in Egypt.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who is chairman of the DPRK-Egypt Friendship Association, and Ri Chang Gun, Ho Yong Bok, So Ho Won, Mun Jae Chol, other officials concerned and representatives of foreign embassies and international organizations here.

articles.title: Prensa Latina News Agency Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Prensa Latina News Agency Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Prensa Latina News Agency of Cuba led by President Luis Enrique Gonzalez Acosta left here Friday.
					 During its stay here, General Director Kim Chang Gwang of the Korean Central News Agency and President Luis Enrique Gonzalez Acosta discussed the matter of further developing the cooperative relations between the two agencies and signed a relevant document.

articles.title: Results of Group G Matches for 2018 AFC U-23 Championship Qualifiers (2)
articles.content:
Results of Group G Matches for 2018 AFC U-23 Championship Qualifiers (2)
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Following are the results from Group G matches for the 2018 AFC U-23 Championship Qualifiers held at the May Day Stadium in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, on Friday.
					 DPRK : Taipei of China 7:1
					
					 Laos : Hong Kong of China 1:1

articles.title: Ministry of People's Armed Forces Hosts Film Show
articles.content:
Ministry of People's Armed Forces Hosts Film Show
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of the People's Armed Forces arranged a film show for the military attaches corps here Friday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the corps and officers of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean documentary film "The Combined Fire Demonstration of the Services of the Korean People's Army Supervised by Respected Supreme Leader Comrade Kim Jong Un in Celebration of the 85th Anniversary of the Heroic KPA".

articles.title: National Taekwon-Do All-Star Tournament for Jonsung Cup Opens
articles.content:
National Taekwon-Do All-Star Tournament for Jonsung Cup Opens
 Nampho, July 21 (KCNA) -- The National Taekwon-Do All-Star Tournament for Jonsung Cup opened with due ceremony at the Nampho Gymnasium Friday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 The tournament will bring together players selected from Taekwon-do teams and Central Physical Training College.
					
					 The players will compete in Taekwon-do and Paduk.
					
					 Attending there were officials concerned, sportspersons and working people.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony a demonstration was given by Taekwon-do players.

articles.title: Disabled People Give Performance
articles.content:
Disabled People Give Performance
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Members of the Korean Art Association of the Disabled gave a performance "We Love Our Country" at the People's Palace of Culture from July 16 to 21.
					 Their colorful numbers included female solo "I Love You Socialism", poem-reciting "I Will Live with You Only", accordion trio "Young People, Be Loyal to Our Party", dance "Yearning", magic "Secret in Box".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's profound humanity and the pride and happiness of living under his loving care.
					
					 Foreign art pieces were also staged.
					
					 The performance was enjoyed by Pyongyangites.

articles.title: Medical Scientific Achievements Made
articles.content:
Medical Scientific Achievements Made
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University in the DPRK has recently made tens of medical scientific achievements, thus contributing to the improvement of people's health.
					 A research group of its ophthalmologic department developed a visual electro-diagnostic testing system which can diagnose ophthalmic diseases and estimate the state of treatment.
					
					 Its clinical research centre also completed the replantation of amputated arm, which had remained unexplored in the fields of microsurgery and plastic surgery.
					
					 And the pharmaceutical department issued a manual for the "DPRK Pharmacopoeia" (seventh edition) and made a new supplementary helpful to giving up smoking.
					
					 The medical sci-tech exchange company developed an anion generator, glasses for quickening the working of brain, etc., all of which favor sportspersons in relieving fatigue and raising their adaptability to games.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Germany's Double-faced Behavior on Security Issue
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Germany's Double-faced Behavior on Security Issue
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Recently the Bundestag of Germany examined the issue of possessing nuclear deterrence common to Europe and came to conclusion that it was possible from a legal point of view, according to reports.
					 The Polish online magazine W Prost quoted a U.S. media report on July 6, saying that the Bundestag of Germany examined the issue of European countries of jointly possessing nuclear deterrence by the way of hiring out the nukes of France or UK, nuclear weapons states in Europe, and concluded that it is lawful and practically possible when adopting a relevant law.
					
					 If this is true, Germany recognizes, though belatedly, that security of Europe should be protected by Europe itself and the fullest guarantee for security is to possess nuclear deterrence.
					
					 European countries, most of them being member nations of NATO, largely depend on the U.S. in defence and security fields.
					
					 These days conflict between EU and the U.S. is aggravating after the Trump administration demanded increased expense for defence of NATO members and EU security policy is changing. 
					
					 The European Commission president said in a lecture on June 9 that defense of Europe should not depend on others, expressing the intention to strengthen its own capabilities for defense. The European Commission announced on June 7 that it launched a European Defense Fund.
					
					 EU member nations decided to jointly import transport planes, submarines and combat and technical equipment and agreed to form a smaller air transport unit and they are busy with the moves to boost their own military capabilities. 
					
					 The Bundestag of Germany's measure of examining the bill shows the strategic calculation to achieve the fullest security guarantee with nuclear deterrence of Europe, not "nuclear umbrella" of the U.S., for fear of the U.S. uncertain commitment to defense of Europe.
					
					 In fact, media and former and incumbent high ranking politicians of Germany discuss on the nuclear deterrence and this is the unprecedented act showing its big interests and concerns about the security. 
					
					 What matters is that Germany, which is greatly interested in its own security, often slanders the DPRK, turning blind eyes to the inevitability of its access to nukes and bolstering up its nuclear force.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nukes and bolstered nuclear force is to defend sovereignty and vital rights of the country and regional peace and security from the evermore escalating nuclear threats of the U.S. which have lasted for several decades. This is very clear to everyone.
					
					 Nevertheless, politicians of Germany fault the nuclear deterrence of the DPRK whenever a chance is given to them. It is the wicked and black-hearted idea that they have nothing to do with other's security issue.
					
					 If Germany is interested in the global peace and security, it should not fault other's nuclear deterrence but urge the U.S. to give up its hostile policy and nuclear threats to the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Stop Sophism against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Stop Sophism against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Japan Foreign Ministry have gone impudent here and there.
					 Vice Foreign Minister Kiyoshi Otawara flew to Nepal where he let out sophism about "abduction plan" of the DPRK. Calling for control over the travel of north Korean citizens", he solicited for cooperation for isolating and stifling the DPRK including suspension of all exchanges with the DPRK.
					
					 Foreign Minister Kishida when meeting the UN secretary general in New York on July 18 requested prompt stronger "sanctions" against the DPRK, saying "north Korea has become threat of higher level. Now is time to tighten pressure".
					
					 This is a clear revelation of the anti-DPRK confrontation frenzy of the Japanese reactionaries steeped in hostility toward the DPRK to the marrow of their bones.
					
					 Japan is not entitled to say anything about the Korean people.
					
					 Still remaining as unhealed scar in the minds of our people are all kinds of shame and contempt they met at the hands of Japan.
					
					During their colonial rule, the Japanese imperialists brutally killed one million innocent Korean people and forcibly drafted 8.4 million young and middle-aged men to force them into hard work. They also abducted 200,000 Korean women, reducing them to sexual playthings of the Imperial Japanese Army. This was an intolerable insult to the nation.
					
					 In recent years, disclosures were made that the Japanese anti-DPRK organizations and figures made their way to DPRK-China border areas under the guise of "humanitarianism" and abducted a number of DPRK citizens to Japan by employing appeasement, deception and all other crafty and despicable methods.
					
					 Such a country is making a fuss over "threat of abduction", not content with faulting the measure for self-defence of the DPRK. The reason is because they committed huge crimes against the Korean people.
					
					 It is quite natural that crime-woven Japan has jitters in the face of the tremendous might and the strategic position of the DPRK which towered as a nuclear power in the East and a world-level rocket power.
					
					 The Japanese always suffering from extreme uneasiness and horror let out a story of "threat" day and night, getting surprised by a rustling sound.
					
					 Crimes are bound to bring punishment.
					
					 Japan's frantic act of sanctions and pressure by following in the footsteps of the U.S. will be a suicidal act of stepping into the striking range itself.
					
					 The DPRK keeps tabs on all the crimes committed by Japan and strongly warned that should Japan come out hostile toward the DPRK without facing up to the situation, it will face the strike by powerful ballistic rockets of the DPRK.
					
					 Japan had better keep its mouth shut if it wants to maintain even the desolate islands in the Pacific.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Talk about "China Responsible" for DPRK's Self-defensive Step
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Talk about "China Responsible" for DPRK's Self-defensive Step
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. talk about "China responsible" for bolstering up nuclear force of the DPRK is no more than despicable and cynical ploy to pass the blame upon others, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's access to H-bomb, strategic sub-based ballistic missile and ICBM, the final gate to rounding off the national nuclear force, is the "feats" of the U.S., which has compelled it to bolster up the nuclear force through persistent nuclear blackmail.
					
					 The U.S. pressure upon the DPRK by wooing China can never break the tradition of friendship sealed in blood through the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. resistance of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The history of traditional friendship of the two peoples, the masters and makers of history, cannot be written off no matter how impudently such gangster-like state as the U.S. behaves.
					
					 In protest against the U.S. pressure, the public is becoming vocal in China that "China is not a country which carries out a decision according to the domestic law of any other country", "China resolutely rejects other's interference in internal affairs as a "law-governed state" and "China is maintaining the blood-sealed relations with the DPRK".
					
					 The U.S. should behave with discretion, mindful that it will meet shame and rebuff only if it calculates it could disregard self-respect of a sovereign state and the tradition of history and consider someone as its sentry and chariot run by its whip.

articles.title: Poor Joblessness of S. Korean University Graduates
articles.content:
Poor Joblessness of S. Korean University Graduates
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- University graduates are suffering from the worst unemployment in south Korea.
					 The Wall Street Journal on Tuesday said that diplomas are worthless in south Korea and it is the self-portrait of young south Koreans in 2017.
					
					 The south Korean News 1 on Wednesday aired that more than 17,000 university students are prolonging their graduation in south Korea as it is difficult to get a job.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Denounces Hiroshima Court for Backing Discrimination of Korean Schools
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Denounces Hiroshima Court for Backing Discrimination of Korean Schools
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo on Thursday carried an article denouncing the Hiroshima District Court for backing the Japanese government's discrimination of Korean schools in Japan.
					 The article said the Hiroshima District Court dismissed a suit demanding compensation of students and graduates of Korean schools in protest against the Japanese government for excluding Korean schools from the list of recipients of aid fund for high schools on Wednesday. 
					
					 The article said Japan has not made reflection of the colonial rule over Korea in the past and it is now thinking that Japan should dominate Korea again anytime.

articles.title: Action for Defending Koreans' Right to National Education Staged in Japan
articles.content:
Action for Defending Koreans' Right to National Education Staged in Japan
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Friday action was staged outside the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on July 14 censuring the Japanese authorities for banning the tuition-free program for the Korean schools in Japan.
					 It was attended by students of Korean University and their parents, Korean residents in Japan and Japanese figures.
					
					 The participants said that only the Korean schools have been still banned from payment of subsidies.
					
					 The Japanese government's move is against humanity as it is an unfair ethnic discrimination and violates even the rights of the children to learn, they said.

articles.title: Monument to Victims of Sexual Slavery Erected in U.S.
articles.content:
Monument to Victims of Sexual Slavery Erected in U.S.
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Association of Koreans in New Jersey of the U.S. reportedly had a monument to the victims of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army erected.
					 The inscription on the monument reads that 200,000 women who were abducted and forced to live as sexual slaves by the Japanese army should be remembered and their dreadful condition should not be forgotten.
					
					 The speakers at its unveiling ceremony on July 19 said that such history and crime should not be repeated.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Egypt, Equatorial Guinea, DR Congo, Zimbabwe, Ecuador and Belarus between June 27 and July 7 to commemorate the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt who is chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association said that the President founded the immortal Juche idea, the Songun idea, defeated the two imperialists, the U.S. and Japan, in one generation and turned the DPRK into a dignified socialist state.
					
					 The director of the International Affairs Department of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea and other speakers praised the President as the eternal leader of the Korean people, saying that he liberated the country from the Japanese imperialists and devoted all his life to the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The chairperson of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo and the chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association lauded the ideo-theoretical exploits of the President who showed the road ahead of the world's progressives by providing the immortal guidelines for the human cause of independence.
					
					 The director general of the Television Station "Tele Andina 23" of Ecuador stressed that Kim Il Sung is a great man with noble personality and virtues.
					
					 The chairman of the Permanent Standing Committee of the Belarus National Association of Friends of Korean People Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il said that the President would be always alive in the mind of humankind for his exploits.

articles.title: DPRK's Tough Stand against U.S. Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Tough Stand against U.S. Supported
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Gorka Patra on July 15 carried an article titled "North Korea after ICBM test-launch".
					 Noting that the news of the successful ICBM test-launch by the DPRK, not a big country in Asia, has rocked the world, the article said:
					
					 This successful test-fire threw a punch to the U.S. which developed and installed THAAD with investment of enormous amount of money.
					
					 The DPRK is meeting the U.S. challenge with the strongest counteractions, though the latter mobilized all type nuclear strike means to subdue the former militarily.
					
					 The U.S. should remember that standoff is not a solution.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Korea's Reunification Introduced
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Korea's Reunification Introduced
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Organizations and media of different countries observed the 45th anniversary of the July 4 inter-Korean statement on July 3 and 4.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article titled "General reunification principles for the nation that provided basic cornerstone for national reunification movement".
					
					 The publication of the July 4 joint statement is a precious fruition borne by President Kim Il Sung's steadfast idea of independent reunification and ardent patriotism, the article said, adding:
					
					 Thanks to the President who cherished the earnest national desire for the reunification and put his heart and soul into realizing it, the north-south high-level political talks were held at which the Three Principles of National Reunification were declared solemnly.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the Oct. 4 declaration, provided through the two rounds of historic Pyongyang inter-Korean summits, are embodiment, succession and practical development of the Three Principles of National Reunification.
					
					 Myanmar's newspaper The Weekly Headline in an article titled "The cause of Korea's reunification" noted that the President had wisely led the work to settle the issue of the country's reunification by the Korean nation itself.
					
					 The internet homepage of the France-Korea Friendship Association introduced in detail the exploits of the President who opened up the bright prospect for the Korean nation's reunification movement by always adhering to the stand of national independence in the cause of national reunification and advancing the fair and aboveboard reunification proposals.

articles.title: Portavoz de AEDHC condena complot anti-RPDC en esfera de "DDHH"
articles.content:
Portavoz de AEDHC condena complot anti-RPDC en esfera de "DDHH"
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- En entrevista con la ACNC concedida este viernes en relacion con que en estos dias, una chusma trama el complot anti-RPDC en el tema de "derechos humanos", el portavoz de la Asociacion de Estudio de Derechos Humanos de Corea (AEDHC) dio la siguiente respuesta:
					  Hace poco, el subdirector de la "Alianza Civil por Derechos Humanos en el Norte de Corea", entidad intrigante de "DDHH" anti-RPDC con sede en Seul, hizo referencia a la invitacion cursada a las companias extranjeras de publicidad a la competencia abierta de retadores de Pyongyang de 2017 de la Federacion Internacional de Tenis de Mesa que tendra lugar en agosto. El chismeo que ellos se oponen a las actividades de esas companias en el Norte de Corea porque los ingresos provenientes del anuncio pueden caer en manos del gobierno norcoreano que esta sometido a las sanciones rigurosas.
					
					  Por otra parte, se dice que el "relator especial" del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU sobre la situacion de DDHH en la RPDC planea reunirse entre el 17 y 21 de julio en el Sur de Corea con las autoridades del gobierno y los "fugitivos norcoreanos" para recoger las "informaciones" mas recientes sobre la "situacion de DDHH" del Norte de Corea y presentar el "informe" al respecto ante la 72a sesion de la Asamblea General de la ONU que se abrira en octubre.
					
					  Es un hecho bien conocido que las actividades de propaganda a traves de las reconocidas competencias deportivas como la abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang organizada por la ITTF son una costumbre internacional y se realizan segun el contrato comercial entre la parte organizadora del evento y las companias de anuncio y que sus rentas se emplean en el desarrollo de deportes.
					
					  Sin embargo, la entidad arriba referida cuestiona hasta el problema de ingresos de anuncio vinculandolo con la antietica sancion contra la RPDC, lo cual es un acto atrevido.
					
					Esta claro que ella persigue el malsano objetivo politico bajo el control de las fuerzas hostiles.
					
					  La "Alianza Civil por Derechos Humanos en el Norte de Corea" deberia cambiar su nombre por el de "Alianza Civil por DDHH en el Sur de Corea" y cuestionar los actos de violacion de DDHH que se perpetran en el suelo surcoreano, incluyendo la discriminacion a los obreros extranjeros y el abuso sexual.
					
					En particular, ha de remediar los casos de violacion sexual a las mujeres locales por parte de los diplomaticos surcoreanos acreditados en varios paises, los cuales se destapan uno tras otro causando la consternacion del mundo.
					
					  Es invariable nuestra posicion de rechazar totalmente la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC, fabricada por las fuerzas hostiles a base de los falsos testimonios de los "fugitivos norcoreanos", desperdicios biologicos, y al "relator especial" sobre la situacion de DDHH en la RPDC nombrado segun ese documento.
					
					  No obstante, partiendo de la posicion de promover activamente el dialogo y la cooperacion para la proteccion y el fomento de los verdaderos DDHH en la escena internacional, nuestro pais invito en mayo pasado a la relatora especial para los derechos de discapacitados perteneciente al Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU y debatio sinceramente con ella el tema de implementacion de la Convencion sobre los Derechos de las Personadas con Discapacidades de que es signataria la RPDC.
					
					  Igualmente, participara en las reuniones de evaluacion del informe de ejecucion de la Convencion sobre los Derechos de Ninos y la Convencion de Eliminacion de Todas Formas de Discriminacion contra la Mujer en septiembre y noviembre que vienen.
					
					  Lo que debe hacer primero el "relator especial" sobre la situacion de DDHH en la RPDC es investigar consecuentemente la situacion de violacion de DDHH en el Sur de Corea, tundra de DDHH del mundo, sin tratar de buscar los "testimonios" de los "fugitivos norcoreanos" que no convencen ya a la gente. 
					
					Ademas, tiene que llevar a la justicia a los criminales que raptaron en grupo a nuestras ciudadanas y las retienen por la fuerza por mas de un ano en el Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Portavoz de CRN condena a conservadores surcoreanos desafiantes a opinion publica
articles.content:
Portavoz de CRN condena a conservadores surcoreanos desafiantes a opinion publica
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- En estos dias se alzan en el Sur de Corea las voces de los habitantes de diversos circulos de descubrir todos los crimenes de corrupcion cometidos por el "poder" de Park Geun-hye y castigar de manera inmediata y severa a sus autores y complices. Y se dinamizan las investigaciones generales sobre los casos corruptos de Park Geun-hye y Choe Sun Sil, la intervencion del Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia en los asuntos politicos, la corrupcion de la esfera de la industria armamentista y otros problemas.
					En tal situacion quedaron descubiertos de nuevo en Chongwadae mil y cientos de documentos internos que demuestran nitidamente los crimenes de la banda de Park, consternando toda la sociedad surcoreana.
					
					En una declaracion publicada el dia 20, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional califica el "poder" de Park Geun-hye del carcinoma maligna, el criadero de corrupcion y el mas sucio en la historia surcoreana que cometio los crimenes inauditos e imperdonables ante la poblacion surcoreana y toda la nacion.
					
					　Pese a esta realidad, la banda conservadora arma alborotos acusando la investigacion criminologica como la "represalia politica" y "enfrentamiento legal", lo que deviene una burla y desafio intolerables a la opinion publica surcoreana levantada con velas encendidas, asi senala el portavoz y continua:
					
					Si no eliminan despiadadamente la pandilla de conservadores que hacen ultimos esfuerzos para escaparse del abismo, no podran frenar la repeticion de la epoca tenebrosa llena de verguenza y desgracia seculares como la del "poder" de Park Geun-hye. Esto es la advertencia de la historia y la realidad.
					
					La banda conservadora es ya la basura de la historia y lo unico que le queda es la sentencia severa de la opinion publica.
					
					Por mas que se desespera para evadir de la sentencia final marchando a contrapelo de la infrenable corriente de la epoca, la banda conservadora demostrara su facha sucia y causara la condena y desilusion mas duras del interior y el exterior del pais.

articles.title: Vocero de FNCE denuncia a EE.UU. que impone al Sur de Corea renegociar el TLC
articles.content:
Vocero de FNCE denuncia a EE.UU. que impone al Sur de Corea renegociar el TLC
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- El portavoz de la Federacion Nacional de Colaboracion Economica hizo publica hoy una declaracion condenando a Estados Unidos que impone al Sur de Corea las renegociaciones sobre el "Tratado de Libre Comercio".
					Hace poco, Trump hizo a la Representacion de Comercio de EE.UU. notificar unilateralmente a las autoridades surcoreanas el inicio del procedimiento de renegociaciones del TLC y por consiguiente, el Sur de Corea se vio obligado a acudir a la mesa de renegociaciones, comienza la nota y continua:
					
					Ese aviso unilateral demuestra el cinismo de EE.UU. que para los intereses propios, no toma en consideracion el destino de su lacayo colonial.
					
					El "TLC" Sur de Corea-EE.UU. fue firmado por el traidor Lee Myung Bak rendido ante el mandato de EE.UU.
					
					Ese pacto leonino y vendepatria no aporta ningun provecho a la economia del Sur de Corea ni a la vida de su poblacion.
					
					En virtud del mismo, quedaron abiertos totalmente los mercados de productos agropecuarios y pescados y el dominio de servicios. Ademas, resultaron relajadas las anteriores regulaciones sobre la limitacion de inversiones extranjeras en las industrias claves que fueron sometidas al capital de monopolios norteamericanos.
					
					Todos los hechos delatan que EE.UU. es el dominante y saqueador cinico que para sus objetivos egoistas, no le importan nada el arruinamiento de la economia surcoreana ni la depauperacion de la vida del pueblo surcoreano.
					
					El Sur de Corea tiene el destino fatal de sacrificar todo lo suyo para su amo gringo que trata de saquearle cada vez mas. Esto es el producto inevitable de los actos proyanquis de los sucesivos gobernantes surcoreanos.
					
					Aunque las autoridades surcoreanas encomian la "alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU.", no podran ocultar su miserable situacion de marionetas de EE.UU.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas, que supuestamente representan la opinion publica reflejada en velas encendidas, no deben sufrir mas verguenzas obedeciendo a ciegas a EE.UU. sino separarse con valentia de la politica sumisa y servil a este imperio.

articles.title: Vicecanciller coreano realiza visita de felicitacion a embajada egipcia en Corea
articles.content:
Vicecanciller coreano realiza visita de felicitacion a embajada egipcia en Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- El viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ho Yong Bok, visito a la embajada egipcia en Corea para felicitar el dia nacional de Egipto.
					Felicito al embajador egipcio Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady por el aniversario 65 de la Revolucion del 23 de Julio en Egipto y sostuvo conversaciones con el.
					
					Se refirio a que se consolidan y se desarrollan sin parar las relaciones bilaterales bajo la profunda atencion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un y Su Excelencia Presidente Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.
					
					Y expuso la voluntad de ampliar mas las historicas y tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.
					
					El embajador egipcio expreso agradecimiento por la visita de felicitacion del viceministro y otros funcionarios coreanos del MINREX y manifesto la seguridad de que las largas relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se consolidaran y se desarrollaran en la etapa mas alta conforme al deseo comun de ambos pueblos.
					
					A continuacion, hubo el intercambio de opiniones sobre la situacion del Medio Oriente y la Peninsula Coreana.

Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- El embajador de la Republica Arabe de Egipto acreditado en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady, ofrecio el dia 21 en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang un banquete con motivo del 65o aniversario de la Revolucion del 23 de Julio en Egipto.
